definition: to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
surname Zhan

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
expansion plan/development graph
perturbative expansion (physics)

sentences.english: Therefore, the dissertation concentrates on the research of localization in WSNs.
sentences.chinese: 因此，本论文围绕无线传感器网络定位技术展开研究。

sentences.english: An airbag that deploys a second later than it should is worse than no airbag at all.
sentences.chinese: 晚一秒钟展开气囊比没有气囊的情况更糟糕。

sentences.english: We spread the map out on the table.
sentences.chinese: 我们把地图展开铺在桌子上。

sentences.english: The paper deals with the convegence of Riesz operators for Jacobi expansions.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了雅可比展开的黎斯算子的若干逼近性质。

sentences.english: A similar effort is under way in France on coffee plants.
sentences.chinese: 类似的工作正在法国展开，保存的是咖啡树种。

sentences.english: Remember the terrible accident that opened each episode of the old television show?
sentences.chinese: 想起旧电视节目上展开每段情节的可怕事件了吗？

sentences.english: The two dueled, transforming the office of politics into an arena of lightsaber combat.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩展开决斗，把政府办公室变成光剑格斗场。

sentences.english: John's about to start a nine-week national speaking tour.
sentences.chinese: 约翰即将展开一场历时九周的全国巡回演讲。

sentences.english: Two arms strech out naturally, even with one rope connecting two hands.
sentences.chinese: 用一根绳子绑住两只手，双臂依然能够展开。

sentences.english: Each waged its own separate war.
sentences.chinese: 每军种独立展开自己的战争。

sentences.english: The Syrian government launched a violent campaign against pro-democracy protesters in March.
sentences.chinese: 叙利亚政府三月份对主张民主的示威者展开暴力镇压。

sentences.english: Liu Mengmei is swept off his feet by the ghost of Du Liniang. A romance unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 柳梦梅与夜访的杜丽娘一见如故，展开一段人鬼情。

sentences.english: A turkey vulture spreads its wings in one of California's deserts.
sentences.chinese: 一只兀鹰在加州的某个沙漠里展开双翼。

sentences.english: The righteous walls are opening in our educational systems.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的教育系统中，将展开公义的墙垣。

sentences.english: She pleaded for dialogue and talked about democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 她呼吁通过展开对话讨论民主改革问题。

sentences.english: Li-Jieli's story gives us a look behind the factory gates.
sentences.chinese: 李洁丽向我们展开了工厂大门后的故事。

definition: to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
prologue
termination/to finish/to end/to conclude/to close
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
(of competition or fighting) intense/fierce/(of pain) acute/(of an expression of opinion) impassioned/vehement/(of a course of action) drastic/extreme
to-and-fro tussle/closely-fought contest
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to open/to start/(computing) to enable
to tussle/to contend/to contest
at this point/thus/from then on
to penetrate deeply/thorough
one step further/to move forward a step/further onwards
(military) offensive
